name: Residence les Allees du Green

reviews.title: Reasonable appartments in quaint village near Beaune
reviews.text: We normally stay in Novotel, Ibis of something like that. This time we wanted a family as we have three little kids so we opted for Allees du Green with their family apartments which sounded interesting.

The residence is located in a nice old french village just two kilometres off the highway near Beaune. The village has nothing apart for some golf oriented hotels so for restaurants you need to cross the highway and go into Beaune (I can suggest Amarone for Italian or Lotus for Asian food, close to the Novotel), 5 mins drive.
reviews.title: Very well locate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment was basic but good. Two rooms, one with double bed and one high-sleeper. Also the living room has a sofa bed. It was clean and it has a fully equipped kitchen, so all is there. Problem was that there were only blankets and no duvets, so don't be allergic.
reviews.title: Desaster hotel

reviews.text: Also, the breakfast was fully booked. The reservation confirmation said you had to book breakfast before 24 hrs after receipt of the confirmation, but how can I know when the confirmation was going to be sent???
reviews.title: Budget accomodation for a family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, the apartment cost us 90 euros, which is not much, so not much complaints
reviews.title: Very good basic apartment for reasonable price

description: 3 *** residence, which enjoys both the quiet countryside, surrounded by lush parkland bordered by the Golf course 18 holes, its walking and cycling in the famous vineyards (such as Pommard, Meursault, Nuits St Georges, Gevrey-Chambertin), but also the attractiveness of the historic city of Beaune, located just 3 km.
